member.name: T:Syroot.Windows.DbgHelp.MINIDUMP_TYPE
member.summary: Identifies the type of information that will be written to the minidump file by the MiniWriteDump function.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.DbgHelp.MINIDUMP_TYPE.MiniDumpNormal
member.summary: Include just the information necessary to capture stack traces for all existing threads in a process.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.DbgHelp.MINIDUMP_TYPE.MiniDumpWithDataSegs
member.summary: Include the data sections from all loaded modules.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.DbgHelp.MINIDUMP_TYPE.MiniDumpWithFullMemory
member.summary: Include all accessible memory in the process.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.DbgHelp.MINIDUMP_TYPE.MiniDumpWithHandleData
member.summary: Include high-level information about the operating system handles that are active when the minidump is made.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.DbgHelp.MINIDUMP_TYPE.MiniDumpFilterMemory
member.summary: Stack and backing store memory written to the minidump file should be filtered to remove all but the pointer values necessary to reconstruct a stack trace.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.DbgHelp.MINIDUMP_TYPE.MiniDumpScanMemory
member.summary: Stack and backing store memory should be scanned for pointer references to modules in the module list.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.DbgHelp.MINIDUMP_TYPE.MiniDumpWithUnloadedModules
member.summary: Include information from the list of modules that were recently unloaded, if this information is maintained by the operating system.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.DbgHelp.MINIDUMP_TYPE.MiniDumpWithIndirectlyReferencedMemory
member.summary: Include pages with data referenced by locals or other stack memory.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.DbgHelp.MINIDUMP_TYPE.MiniDumpFilterModulePaths
member.summary: Filter module paths for information such as user names or important directories.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.DbgHelp.MINIDUMP_TYPE.MiniDumpWithProcessThreadData
member.summary: Include complete per-process and per-thread information from the operating system.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.DbgHelp.MINIDUMP_TYPE.MiniDumpWithPrivateReadWriteMemory
member.summary: Scan the virtual address space for PAGE_READWRITE memory to be included.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.DbgHelp.MINIDUMP_TYPE.MiniDumpWithoutOptionalData
member.summary: Reduce the data that is dumped by eliminating memory regions that are not essential to meet criteria specified for the dump.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.DbgHelp.MINIDUMP_TYPE.MiniDumpWithFullMemoryInfo
member.summary: Include memory region information.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.DbgHelp.MINIDUMP_TYPE.MiniDumpWithThreadInfo
member.summary: Include thread state information.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.DbgHelp.MINIDUMP_TYPE.MiniDumpWithCodeSegs
member.summary: Include all code and code-related sections from loaded modules to capture executable content.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.DbgHelp.MINIDUMP_TYPE.MiniDumpWithoutAuxiliaryState
member.summary: Turns off secondary auxiliary-supported memory gathering.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.DbgHelp.MINIDUMP_TYPE.MiniDumpWithFullAuxiliaryState
member.summary: Requests that auxiliary data providers include their state in the dump image; the state data that is included is provider dependent.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.DbgHelp.MINIDUMP_TYPE.MiniDumpWithPrivateWriteCopyMemory
member.summary: Scans the virtual address space for PAGE_WRITECOPY memory to be included.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.DbgHelp.MINIDUMP_TYPE.MiniDumpIgnoreInaccessibleMemory
member.summary: If you specify MiniDumpWithFullMemory, the MiniDumpWriteDump function will fail if the function cannot read the memory regions; however, if you include MiniDumpIgnoreInaccessibleMemory, the MiniDumpWriteDump function will ignore the memory read failures and continue to generate the dump.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.DbgHelp.MINIDUMP_TYPE.MiniDumpWithTokenInformation
member.summary: Adds security token related data.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.DbgHelp.MINIDUMP_TYPE.MiniDumpWithModuleHeaders
member.summary: Adds module header related data.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.DbgHelp.MINIDUMP_TYPE.MiniDumpFilterTriage
member.summary: Adds filter triage related data.

member.name: T:Syroot.Windows.Gdi32.TextAlign
member.summary: Represents text alignments. Only one flag can be chosen from those that affect horizontal and vertical alignment. In addition, only one of the two flags that alter the current position can be chosen.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.Gdi32.TextAlign.TA_LEFT
member.summary: The reference point will be on the left edge of the bounding rectangle.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.Gdi32.TextAlign.TA_TOP
member.summary: The reference point will be on the top edge of the bounding rectangle.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.Gdi32.TextAlign.TA_UPDATECP
member.summary: The current position is updated after each text output call. The current position is used as the reference point.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.Gdi32.TextAlign.TA_RIGHT
member.summary: The reference point will be on the right edge of the bounding rectangle.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.Gdi32.TextAlign.TA_CENTER
member.summary: The reference point will be aligned horizontally with the center of the bounding rectangle.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.Gdi32.TextAlign.TA_BOTTOM
member.summary: The reference point will be on the bottom edge of the bounding rectangle.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.Gdi32.TextAlign.TA_BASELINE
member.summary: The reference point will be on the base line of the text.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.Gdi32.TextAlign.TA_RTLREADING
member.summary: The text is laid out in right to left reading order, as opposed to the default left to right order.

member.name: T:Syroot.Windows.HKL
member.summary: A language identifier is a standard international numeric abbreviation for the language in a country or geographical region. Each language has a unique language identifier (data type LANGID), a 16-bit value that consists of a primary language identifier and a sublanguage identifier. For details of language identifiers, see Language Identifier Constants and Strings.

member.name: M:Syroot.Windows.Imm32.ImmAssociateContext(Syroot.Windows.HWND,Syroot.Windows.HIMC)
member.summary: Associates the specified input context with the specified window. By default, the operating system associates the default input context with each window as it is created.
member.param: Handle to the window to associate with the input context.
Handle to the input context. If hIMC is NULL, the function removes any association the window has with an input context. Thus IME cannot be used in the window.
member.returns: Returns the handle to the input context previously associated with the window.

member.name: M:Syroot.Windows.Imm32.ImmGetCompositionString(Syroot.Windows.HIMC,Syroot.Windows.Imm32.ImeCompositionString,System.IntPtr,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Retrieves information about the composition string.
member.param: Handle to the input context.
Index of the information to retrieve, which is one of the values specified in IME Composition String Values.
Pointer to a buffer in which the function retrieves the composition string information.
Size, in bytes, of the output buffer, even if the output is a Unicode string.

member.name: M:Syroot.Windows.Imm32.ImmGetCandidateList(Syroot.Windows.HIMC,System.UInt32,System.IntPtr,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Retrieves a candidate list.
member.param: Handle to the input context.
Zero-based index of the candidate list.
Pointer to a CANDIDATELIST structure in which the function retrieves the candidate list.
Size, in bytes, of the buffer to receive the candidate list. The application can specify 0 for this parameter if the function is to return the required size of the output buffer only.
member.returns: Returns the number of bytes copied to the candidate list buffer if successful. If the application has supplied 0 for the dwBufLen parameter, the function returns the size required for the candidate list buffer.

member.name: M:Syroot.Windows.Imm32.ImmGetIMEFileName(Syroot.Windows.HKL,System.Text.StringBuilder,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Retrieves the file name of the IME associated with the specified input locale.
member.param: Input locale identifier.
Pointer to a buffer in which the function retrieves the file name. This parameter contains 0 when uBufLen is set to 0.

Size, in bytes, of the output buffer. The application specifies 0 if the function is to return the buffer size needed to receive the file name, not including the terminating null character. For Unicode, uBufLen specifies the size in Unicode characters, not including the terminating null character.
member.returns: Returns the number of bytes in the file name copied to the output buffer.

member.name: T:Syroot.Windows.User32.WindowStyleExtended
member.summary: Represents extended window styles.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.User32.WindowStyleExtended.WS_EX_LEFT
member.summary: The window has generic left-aligned properties. This is the default.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.User32.WindowStyleExtended.WS_EX_LTRREADING
member.summary: The window text is displayed using left-to-right reading-order properties. This is the default.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.User32.WindowStyleExtended.WS_EX_RIGHTSCROLLBAR
member.summary: The vertical scroll bar (if present) is to the right of the client area. This is the default.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.User32.WindowStyleExtended.WS_EX_DLGMODALFRAME
member.summary: The window has a double border.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.User32.WindowStyleExtended.WS_EX_NOPARENTNOTIFY
member.summary: The child window created with this style does not send the WM_PARENTNOTIFY message to its parent window when it is created or destroyed.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.User32.WindowStyleExtended.WS_EX_TOPMOST
member.summary: The window should be placed above all non-topmost windows and should stay above them, even when the window is deactivated.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.User32.WindowStyleExtended.WS_EX_ACCEPTFILES
member.summary: The window accepts drag-drop files.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.User32.WindowStyleExtended.WS_EX_TRANSPARENT
member.summary: The window should not be painted until siblings beneath the window (that were created by the same thread) have been painted.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.User32.WindowStyleExtended.WS_EX_MDICHILD
member.summary: The window is a MDI child window.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.User32.WindowStyleExtended.WS_EX_TOOLWINDOW
member.summary: The window is intended to be used as a floating toolbar.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.User32.WindowStyleExtended.WS_EX_WINDOWEDGE
member.summary: The window has a border with a raised edge.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.User32.WindowStyleExtended.WS_EX_CLIENTEDGE
member.summary: The window has a border with a sunken edge.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.User32.WindowStyleExtended.WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP
member.summary: The title bar of the window includes a question mark.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.User32.WindowStyleExtended.WS_EX_RIGHT
member.summary: The window has generic "right-aligned" properties.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.User32.WindowStyleExtended.WS_EX_RTLREADING
member.summary: If the shell language is Hebrew, Arabic, or another language that supports reading-order alignment, the window text is displayed using right-to-left reading-order properties.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.User32.WindowStyleExtended.WS_EX_LEFTSCROLLBAR
member.summary: If the shell language is Hebrew, Arabic, or another language that supports reading order alignment, the vertical scroll bar (if present) is to the left of the client area.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.User32.WindowStyleExtended.WS_EX_CONTROLPARENT
member.summary: The window itself contains child windows that should take part in dialog box navigation.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.User32.WindowStyleExtended.WS_EX_STATICEDGE
member.summary: The window has a three-dimensional border style intended to be used for items that do not accept user input.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.User32.WindowStyleExtended.WS_EX_APPWINDOW
member.summary: Forces a top-level window onto the taskbar when the window is visible.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.User32.WindowStyleExtended.WS_EX_LAYERED
member.summary: The window is a layered window.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.User32.WindowStyleExtended.WS_EX_NOINHERITLAYOUT
member.summary: The window does not pass its window layout to its child windows.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.User32.WindowStyleExtended.WS_EX_NOREDIRECTIONBITMAP
member.summary: The window does not render to a redirection surface.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.User32.WindowStyleExtended.WS_EX_LAYOUTRTL
member.summary: If the shell language is Hebrew, Arabic, or another language that supports reading order alignment, the horizontal origin of the window is on the right edge.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.User32.WindowStyleExtended.WS_EX_COMPOSITED
member.summary: Paints all descendants of a window in bottom-to-top painting order using double-buffering.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.User32.WindowStyleExtended.WS_EX_NOACTIVATE
member.summary: A top-level window created with this style does not become the foreground window when the user clicks it.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.User32.WindowStyleExtended.WS_EX_OVERLAPPEDWINDOW
member.summary: The window is an overlapped window.

member.name: F:Syroot.Windows.User32.WindowStyleExtended.WS_EX_PALETTEWINDOW
member.summary: The window is palette window, which is a modeless dialog box that presents an array of commands.
